tags.name: Attributes
tags.description:
Operations to view data attributes. TDF protocol supports ABAC (Attribute Based Access Control).
        This allows TDF protocol to implement policy driven and highly scalable access control mechanism.

tags.name: Authorities
tags.description: Operations to view and create attribute authorities.

tags.name: Attributes Definitions
tags.description: Operations to manage the rules and metadata of attributes.

tags.name: Entitlements
tags.description: Operations to manage entitlements entitled to entities.

schema.title: Response Read Attributes Definitions Definitions Attributes Get

get.description:
This endpoint is for OPS so they have something to ping on to verify
that the server hasn't died.

get.summary: Return current version as semver; useful for liveness checks
Get the public key for KAS
get.description:
This endpoint provides a public key for the private key that the
kas has internally. The public key is used to wrap object keys in
the TDF3 or NanoTDF files.

post.description:
This endpoint performs the primary service of the KAS; to re-wrap
data keys as needed to provide access for entities with a TDF that they
would like to open.

This endpoint performs the primary service of the KAS; to re-wrap
data keys as needed to provide access for entities with a TDF that they
would like to open.

The upsert service is a proxy to the back-end services that persist
policies and keys.

policies and keys.

Algorithm.title: The algorithm used to encrypt the ciphertext

IV.title: Initial vector used to encrypt the ciphertext

TDF_Algorithm.description: String to define the type of algorithm the client performing the TDF operations.
